summary: An email from July 16, 2019, discussing that a former DOJ official, referred to as 'S', has retained legal representation and is upset about press coverage regarding her involvement in reviewing the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). She is considering making a public statement.

events.title: Defense counsel mentions former DOJ official on record
events.description: Defense counsel mentions on the record that a former DOJ official was involved in reviewing the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Former DOJ official retains counsel and considers public statement
events.description: A former DOJ official, referred to as 'S', retains legal representation and is upset about press coverage regarding her involvement in the Epstein NPA review, considering making a public statement.

keyFacts: A former DOJ official, referred to as 'S', was involved in reviewing the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
This official was mentioned on the record by defense counsel on July 15, 2019.
By July 16, 2019, the official had retained legal representation and was upset about related press coverage, considering a public statement.
The email indicates internal discussions and concern among former DOJ officials regarding public scrutiny of the Epstein NPA process.
